name: KJUN
address: 154 E 39th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

reviews.text: Homey, amazing food and shoutout to Eli!
Amazing food charming service and lots of dairy üòçüôè‚ù§Ô∏è do yourself a favor and come here
Food was absolutely amazing and staff is the kindest!
Fried chicken is great!
Very accomodati4ng for food allergies. Staff was friendly and Engaging. Food was DELICIOUS and filling. Very large portions.
Great food and friendly service. The mix of Korean and Cajun flavors is really tasty. The place is small and cozy. I‚Äôd definitely come back!

Hush puppies served with soul, and bbq ribs with a sweet but spicy sauce that fell off the bone. This is a menu you def wanna check out with friends and family. AND the best hip hop bumpin in the background.

This is one of our favorite places in the city. Everything from the food to the service to the vibes is absolutely top tier. Nothing we've ever had here has been short of incredible.

Recommend:
Galbi brisket with cheesy grits
Fried chicken
Nola BBQ shrimp
Blackened catfish
Pickled tomatoes
Potato daikon salad
Beans and rice (if they have them)

Delicious Korean fusion, really unique ways to pair Korean with Southern food. Everyone working there is super nice, friendly, and attentive. Absolutely loved the Galbi Brisket & Grits, Fried Chicken, and Okra Kimchi. Dessert was also fantastic, highly recommend the Goguma Sweet Potato Pie. Really cozy vibes and got some misgaru drinks as a little extra which was a pleasant surprise!

Amazing atmosphere and amazing food. If you are in need of a date night or night out with friends, this is your place!!! Loved the fried chicken, chicken liver pate, Nola bbq shrimp, okra. Everything was simply amazing!
Chill vibe, delicious grub , welcoming crew ‚Äî 10/10. Will be back often!
Great food, highly recommend the galbi brisket and seafood jajangmyun. There's a bathroom inside the kitchen but I'd recommend going before
All around incredible. Friendly staff and great service. Get the brisket and the pecan dessert!

Amazing staff and an incredibly inviting space. We got the dinner for 2 and it was perfect to try a lot of the menu. Highly recommend the pecan dessert and the brisket and grits. Everything was amazing

Many great places to eat in Murray hill but DO NOT miss this one.

Creative dishes, well seasoned and flavored, good mix of chicken, veggies, red meat and fish with a New Orleans and Korean hybrid flare that makes sure every dish packs a flavor punch without being too heavy.

Would go here again and again
This is the best place for a good Korean fried chicken, love it!
Spectacular!! gReat atmosphere and insane food - tasting menu was a great choice
One of the best and most original food I‚Äôve eaten. Jay (the chef/owner) and Eli are such a vibe. So welcoming, creative, and friendly. It‚Äôs a vibe with incredible dishes. GO HERE.
Loved everything about it
What a ‚Äòmust do‚Äô! Amazing service, delicious surprising dishes, fairly priced. Absolutely worth it.

Holy moly this place is nuts

Incredible food & the entire staff was top tier
Staff awesome. Food awesome. Owner awesome. I just wish that chicken sandwich was always available... Everything we tried was amazing.
KJUN is amazing. The food is off the charts, and we've brought a lot of friends here and everyone raves about it. Compliments to the chef and the rest of the staff!
Absolutely incredible
Visiting from out of town and already planning my next trip so I can eat here again!! SO GOOD, a must try if you‚Äôre within a 1.5hr flight radius.
Been here a couple times and each one has been delicious and such a warm experience. Highly recommend!

My cravings always lead back to this place. The employees' friendly nature makes being here a pleasure. You'll find both style and comfort in the setting. The dessert offerings here show real creativity. I'm content with the experience here.

It‚Äôs pretty ‚Äúcozy‚Äù spot - only seats about 20 in a comfortable and fairly sedate environment
We did the family style meal, which was really ideal. They ask you at the beginning if you want any preferences and of course, I piped up about the.  ‚Äú fried chicken.‚Äù!
They started out with a small squash amuse  bouche, then we had some fritters, followed by a meatball ‚Äúboudin ball‚Äù.
We also had cooked okra and a really unique potato salad. They followed with a delicious gumbo with homemade sausage. Then we had the fried chicken! Wow. Came with hot honey and one other sauce.
The squid in pasta and mushroom with radish on top was last before dessert.
The person waiting tables knew the food backwards and forwards and was a real treat to work with. (Eli!)
They finished the meal with a very small dessert which was kind of a strawberry and cake and whipped cream specialty.
We really love the meal. I found the flavors on every course just exploding in our mouth. Really enjoyed this experience and it‚Äôs a must do!
Unbelievably good. Every dish was spectacular. So much heart and soul in this food! Can‚Äôt wait to go back ‚ù§Ô∏è
Food was great and service great
delicious food! great fast service super nice staff and so so fast!! 100/10 will be back again
Amazing experience. Please get the fried chicken

Can‚Äôt rave enough about this place. We came at prime time and the host tried their best to get us seated and we went for the family set because we were 4 people. The chef was careful to accommodate particular eaters. So everyone was absolutely pleased with what came out. The Kimchee tomato and soy marinated egg amazing to start with. The main dishes were the perfect portion to fill us up.
It was our first time here and we are neighborhood folks and the service made us feel like we are part of them so that warmth hospitality is definitely bringing us back in the future.
FYI it‚Äôs BYOB with a small corkage fee (u less you go for the set) so stop by a local spot grab a bottle and have it with your delicious meal.
It such a unique menu for a neighborhood that is getting diverse.
Great experience! Didn‚Äôt know these flavors combined would be so delicious. The staff were easy to talk to and very attentive. Looking forward to going again.
Great food and great ambiance! The staff here were so nice.

5/5 for the name alone! It‚Äôs such a catchy blend of Korean and Cajun.

We had dinner for two and tried the following dishes: Kimchi Green Tomatoes, Kimchi Okra, Catfish, Hashpuppy (Cornbread), Fried Chicken, Seafood jjajangmyeon, and Strawberry Cornbread with Whipped Cream for dessert.

Our favorite was the Kimchi Green Tomatoes ‚Äî absolutely delicious! The catfish, however, was a bit too salty, and the fried chicken didn‚Äôt quite compare to traditional Southern buttermilk fried chicken or Bonchon‚Äôs version. The jjajangmyeon leaned on the sweet side, and the dessert was a miss for us.

The space is small but cozy, and the service was excellent. Overall, creative concept and great service, but some dishes could use a little fine-tuning.

we did the family meal. service was phenomenal. chef comes out and talks to you frequently. one nit is that the food was extremely heavy. lots of butter lots of oil. especially all the mains. with that said, just come on an empty stomach! it all tasted amazing!
Really good Korean fusion
Amazing (and unique) food, amazing service. Can‚Äôt find a place like this just anywhere
The best place evrrrr amazing staff and food
Cool staff with great energy and atmosphere. The fried chili is amazing. Eli is super cool.

Probably one of our favorite places we have eaten recently! We walked in with no reservation and the staff accommodated us with a table even though it was a busy night. Our favorites were the kimchi jambalaya and the kimchi okra but everything we had was great and looking forward to going back and trying other items on the menu! Also the staff were so nice and friendly :-)
very unique spread, mix of flavors was fun. would come again!!!

one of those, "why didn't I think of that", kind of food combinations - korean and cajun.  actually goes REALLY well together.  highly recommend, but location as of this review is a small spot, but heard from staff they were planning on moving into a bigger place.  so definitely book ahead and keep in mind the place is a tight squeeze!
Loved everything about KJUN! Will be back!

Unique and memorable fried chicken. The combo of New Orleans and Korean style cooking is so unassuming but brilliant. I love what KJUN was able to do here overall, but the thing I‚Äôll remember the most is definitely the fried chicken.
The galbi and grits were the bomb! And get the fried chicken too! Yakult at the end was a nice touch. Service was great too. Highly recommend
We love the food and the service is excellent
Best place ever
Excellent food! Def make a reservation!

My wife and I always have a fun dining experience whenever we eat at KJUN. They do an amazing job combining different cultures to make an incredible menu.  The dishes have evolved over the years and it never disappoints! We had the honey butter chips, hush puppies, tomato kimchi, k-pear salad, fried chicken, galbi brisket & grits, and goguma pecan pie. Each dish was tasty in its own way, but don't sleep on the honey butter chips!!! Such a delicious way to start the meal.
Also the staff here are always so friendly & welcoming.  They really provide such warm hospitality and make the dining experience so enjoyable.  Great food & great staff is a recipe for a memorable meal!

We were warmly welcomed by everyone ‚Äî such a nice and friendly atmosphere! We were lucky to get a table since we didn‚Äôt have a reservation, so I highly recommend making one in advance. It was our first visit, and they kindly explained the fusion-style dishes to us. We shared one appetizer and two mains, and everything was absolutely delicious!! Next time, I‚Äôm excited to try something new!

DELICIOUS. Ordered dinner for 2. Had the japchae boudin balls, green tomato kimchi,  k-pear salad, kimchi jambalaya, galbi + grits, and strawberry yummy. The flavors were phenomenal. I loved it so much. Will definitely be coming back!!!

Genuinely the best meal I've had in NYC in a while! The service was insane (shoutout Eli and Neal and everyone else there!) and the family style meal was great value + delicious :) it's BYOB! Standouts were the gumbo, fried chicken, and the fish! Will definitely be back

We didn‚Äôt have a reservation, but the hostess still managed to seat us right away. She was loud, but in the best way‚Äîsuch a fun vibe and incredibly generous. The food was excellent; we ordered the family dinner, and it was more than enough for everyone. Great experience overall, definitely worth a try.

One of the absolute BEST meals I‚Äôve had this year. That fried chicken with honey and watermelon rind pickles??? Pure genius. My only regret is not having a couple of extra stomachs so I could have ordered the whole menu. Daniel Dae Kim was spot on giving this place a proper shoutout - well deserved. Amazing food, incredible service, and such a warm, welcoming crew and humble chef. Already planning my next visit!

ÏßÑÏßú ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÏÉâÎã§Î•∏ Ï°∞Ìï©Ïù¥Í≥† ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÎßõÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî!!
Really loved this Korean fusion place.

My personal favorites:
1) green tomato kimchi (the most brilliant thing ive had in the past few months) cant stop eating. Want to buy a whole jar of it to keep it home

2) japchae boudin ball. Loveeee!! So filling and seasoned perfectly

3) galbi main dish. This was more predictable but regardless, DELISH!!

4) Watermelon and pear salad. Also more predictable in terms of combination od ingridients and flavors but again, good food is good food

Came to NYC specifically to check out this restaurant. This place is going viral recently and this place has definitely earned the hype. One of my new favorite restaurants. We ordered the 2 person set menu. It was SO much food and all of it delicious. The service is fantastic, the owner was there the entire time talking to her customers, can‚Äôt wait to get back. EVERYTHING was amazing, with that said, our rank was as follows:
1. Fried chicken
2. Green Tomato kimchi
3. Brisket or Jjapchae balls (!?)
4. Potato salad

Fantastic all around. Amazing food, service, and vibes.

Came with a group of four and did the family meal where the chef serves dishes to be shared with the table. Starting from the banchan to the honey butter Cajun chips - every bite was unique and delicious.

Highly recommend stopping by, wont be disappointed ü•π

Partirei col recensire questo ristorante parlando in primis del suo personale, siamo stati serviti con gentilezza e pazienza nonostante le difficolt√† linguistiche. Siamo stati consigliati benissimo e le nostre esigenze sono state ampiamente ascoltate, e ad essere sincera per un ristorante coreano riuscire a bilanciare perfettamente il piccante per chi altamente sensibile a volte pu√≤ essere un‚Äôimpresa o un limite, ma loro ci sono riusciti benissimo!
Non hanno il classico men√π da ristorante coreano, bens√¨ offrono un menu per me inaspettato: abbiamo preso le uova marinate in salsa di soia che andavano accompagnate da crackers di pelle di pollo fritta, il sandwich di pollo fritto con le patatine fritte nel burro e con il miele sopra, il kimchi della mamma e un‚Äôinsalata di patate e daikon.
I miei piatti preferiti sono stati sia le uova che il sandwich di pollo, che aveva sia un‚Äôamabile componente esperienziale (infatti dovevi comporlo tu seguendo le istruzioni) che una zuppetta di accompagno davvero buonissima.
Inoltre abbiamo preso da bere un th√© fatto in casa alla pesca e un succo sempre fatto in casa.
Il ristorante √® davvero adorabile, piccolo con cucina a vista per cui vi consiglio di prenotare se volete farvi visita!

Small and intimate restaurant where you can taste the soul and love of the chef. The unexpected combo of Korean and Cajun food yields great flavor profiles and textures! Every dish was awesome and wish I have more room to eat more!

What a wonderful night! A double date with some wonderful friends, incredible food, and attentive service from a caring staff and the chef who clearly loves what she does. Some of the best food I have ever had. We never had a second with an empty plate or cup. We had the family meal, and every dish was delicious. The bon chon was refreshing and cut through the richness of the rest of our meal. I was too excited to eat the most tender beef and grits, and the falling-off-the-bone pork ribs to take a picture. WOW!!

Food and service were amazing! Would definitely recommend to anybody. The space is a little tight inside in some of the seating but not the worst. Washrooms is in the back through the kitchen so this tells you how small the whole restaurant is.

One of our snacks came out a little cold and they gave us a brand new one as well as another snack to make up for it. Service was amazing and everyone apologized for it, even though this obviously can happen to any establishment. Zero corkage fee when choosing a set menu is amazing and I‚Äôd definitely recommend bringing a bottle if you have one, they‚Äôll keep it on ice and provide some ice for the drinks as well.

The daikon potato and okra kimchi sides are hits, but I‚Äôm sure all the sides are good. The standouts for me were the snacks, which were the cornbread hush puppies and the japchae balls. These were so good, definitely try one or the other or both if possible.

The kimchi fried rice and brisket grits mains were both amazing. I would say the brisket grits was more unique but both were great in flavour. The fried chicken was really good but since everything was else was so unique and yummy I‚Äôd say I would recommend trying more of the other food rather than getting just chicken. Ideally adding a piece of chicken for $9 to the set menu seems like the best way to try it.

10/10 recommend!!!

Everything was so good. We got the fried chicken with okra kimchi (underrated) and the cheesy grits. For an appetizer, we ordered cod beignets, which were good but on the greasy side since they were fried. But worth it.

I would love to try the cornbread and the brisket next time. Overall, it was a good meal, the service was fast, and the meal was good, but don't go in without a reservation. They‚Äôre always packed

The food here was excellent ‚Äî based on taste alone, this would easily be a 5-star review. Every dish we tried was well-prepared and delicious.

Unfortunately, the overall experience fell short. The restaurant was uncomfortably hot, to the point where I couldn‚Äôt fully enjoy or even focus on the food the way I should have. Additionally, the restroom setup was disappointing; you have to walk through the kitchen while staff are working, which felt unsafe and not very sanitary.

We spent about $145 for two people (including tip), so roughly $70+ per person. At that price point, I expect not just great food but also a comfortable, enjoyable dining experience. While the food impressed me, the environment did not, and that‚Äôs why I can‚Äôt give a full 5 stars.

Only in NYC can you find such a beautiful marriage of Cajun and Korean flavors. The food was so good that I could only take a picture of the starter, all times was focused on devouring these meals. Highly recommend for date night or dinner with the girls. A must is the misugaru drink! 10/10 recommend.

KJUN has been on my "want to try" list since moving to New York, so I was very happy to walk in yesterday. Service was quick, attentive, and the food was just absolutely delicious. I've watched like 15 seasons of Top Chef in the past month so it's all begun to blur together a little, and I was so happy, when watching Season 19, to see that a contestant owns KJUN, and it just furthered my desire to go. And then yesterday, somehow, I had a complete brain fart and only remembered it was Chef Jae when I heard her voice. Chef Jae, if you ever see this, your food is phenomenal, and A+ service. This is what dining should be, comfortable, tasty, and so good for the soul. The menu tastes exactly as it's described: a Korean-Cajun mix. It was flavorful, bold, unexpected and just so, so, so satisfying on a beautiful sunny day. Highlights were the hush puppies, rice & beans, and fried chicken. So basically the entire meal.

We tried this place while visiting New York City. We read reviews and thought a place to try. Unfortunately rather disappointing.  We ordered a fish plate at $15 and it was one small filet and no sides (picture attached). Flavor and taste ok. Also ordered 3 piece fried chicken at $27. It came with no sides and it didn't even deserve a picture.  It was greasy, flavor ok and definitely not worth $27. Small place with minimal seating.  I won't recommend this place it is way overpriced for quality of food.

The chicken and the boudin balls are to die for. The kimchi mari guksi and the jambalaya were also amazing!

Overall the service was great. Queue was long though, waited for about 1.5 hours on a weekday. Also, the table was really small to fit 3 people, and we had to leave a dish on a side chair. Would‚Äôve been better if there were more table space.

I wandered in solo, they were packed and were able to squeeze me in for a meal. It was so worth the trek there! Had Jajangmyeon it was so rich in flavor, practically scarfed it down. Plus the service was amazing, was checked on a few times and water was quickly refilled. Truly a pleasant experience and will definitely bring friends over next time!

Fun little place, great concept, lovely service. Everything was cooked well, although maybe alcohol is a must if you are sensitive to salty food.

We had the $66pp family dinner and things were on the salty side. Everything that came out was salty on a scale of fine (okra kimchi/butter chips) to pretty salty (fried chicken/japchae balls) to really salty. Might just be us but we had some difficulty with the black bean noodles (jjajang), watermelon salad (in the spoons), and the strawberry dessert (the cookie crumbs). The restaurant did reach out to tell us that they would take the feedback into account! The flavor profiles were otherwise good. Maybe would come back for their lunch specials, which sound really fun.

Otherwise we loved the concept and the gumbo was truly amazing. The place is a little cramped and hectic but fun, definitely more pub ish than fine dining (and drinking to help cut the oil/salt).

Who knew a fusion between Cajun & Korean cuisine could produce such amazing flavors. We did the menu for two and loved everything we chose. There is limited seating so either get there early or make a reservation. Both waiters that attended to us were fantastic and took time to chat with us while answering our curious questions about Kjun!

Tiny hall in the wall place. Love the fusion of Korean and Cajun cuisine. The flavors balance and play off each other quite well. My personal favorites were the seafood noodles and the fried chicken. The green tomato kimchi was also tasty. I liked the peach sweet tea as well. Would def go back!

Overall for a fusion restaurant that always leaves me skeptical, it was surprisingly well done! Some dishes were more of a hit than others but I think overall the ones that worked, worked. The ones that didn‚Äôt as much- I think it can be better executed. We opted for the tasting menu which showcased all of the dishes, and with that the corkage fee was waived for us due to the size of our party. So I have to say I do appreciate the restaurant for making that accommodation.

We traveled to New York for my fianc√©s bday and this place was recommended by one of our friends and since we‚Äôre Korean and getting married in NOLA, this was a no brainer. It was almost meant to be that we came across this spot. The restaurant is verrryyy small and so small in order to get to the bathroom, you have to go through the very small kitchen. With that said it is a nice touch that you can see the kitchen as I‚Äôve always been a fan of open kitchen concepts.

The service I have to say was 50-50. The person identified as a chef and owner did not seem as welcoming as she was the one manding the front door. I realize that her and her team were getting our table ready however we have been to other restaurants in New York City that were just as busy and the owner or manager was willing to take a few seconds to welcome us. On that note when we made the reservation, we were told over the phone to come earlier which we still ended up waiting about 20 to 25 minutes longer than our reservation time. However, I will say the service was made up by the wait staff because they were amazing. They were energetic, attentive, prompt, and very engaging.

Now let‚Äôs move onto the food. Some of my most favorite dishes was the take on jajangmyun with squid ink, collard greens, pork ribs, and the honey butter chips. The star of the night was the okra which I do not like but in this application was delicious, a little sweet, tangy and crunchy. No dish was disappointing per se as they all tasted good, it was the fusion aspect that was lacking in some.

Easily some of the best fried chicken I‚Äôve ever had. Incredibly juicy and crispy, great flavors with the sauces and sides. Got the lunch chicken sandwich special takeout, and the greeter was so incredibly kind, making sure we were comfortable while waiting.

Love the kimchi stew side ‚Äî tart, spicy, comforting. Easily a compliment to any dish.

The chicken had a great coating! The chili oil gave it great fragrance and the horseradish sauce paired really well with the mint and radish toppings. Love a good potato bun, duh.

Kimchi soup: 9.6
Chicken Sando: 9.8

Best experience at a restaurant in New York. The food was amazing and well worth it. The chef is one of a kind and very friendly. The staff is also friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend the fried chicken and okra kimchi. Went with the meal for 2 and both of us left stuffed.

I‚Äôd been wanting to try this Cajun-Korean spot ever since I read about it in The New York Times, and it absolutely lived up to the hype. We ordered the family meal, which came with multiple courses and was well worth it. Everything we tried was bursting with flavor. The dishes were creative and perfectly executed, and the staff was warm and welcoming, making the whole experience even better. This is definitely a spot I‚Äôll be recommending to friends.

Wait time can be lengthy. It's a little expensive, but reasonably priced considering taste, serving size, and location (it's the middle of Manhattan, mid-range price considering nearby restaurants). No other restaurant does it like Kjun, and I don't use that language regularly. Staff are amazing and welcoming. It's a small restaurant, and parking is scarce. This is a MUST TRY RESTAURANT whenever you are in the area. 10/10 all the food is amazing.

Everything was so tasty and flavorful! Definitely must come! It‚Äôs very unique to have fusion Korean and New Orleans flavors. We called on day of and they were very kind to fit us in. The place is very small so
Reservations is definitely recommended.

Had a fantastic dinner at KJUN. The fusion  makes so much sense once you try the dishes. My favorites were the cod beignet, brisket and grits, and the green tomato kimchi. Fantastic balance and flavors!

My bestie üíì called and made last minute reservation for my birthday. Jay the lady who took our reservation, not sure if she the owner, but she was very sweet and attentive. The place was fast pace but balanced and yet relaxing. I able to enjoy a Birthday meal with my bestie. We were able to enjoy our food and view other table food to see what  experiences we were missing. Im not one to try new food, but my bestie knows more about food and this was a good choice. My favorite is the Green tomato kimchi!

This is a top 10 dining experience of my entire life. Hands down. Multiple things I ate here are some of the best things I have ever eaten. Hands down.

For $70 a person for the quality and variety of everything I ate, one of the best deals in this country. Worth every penny.

If you go, get the seafood noodles, honey butter chips, and cheesy grits. Life changing. And do the family meal.

If I could give chef Jae and her team more than 5 stars, I would! From exceptional hospitality to top notch food, Kjun delivers above and beyond. The Korean-Cajun fusion was incredible - highly recommend the fried-to-order potato chips, japchae boudin balls, grits, and gumbo!

This is a truly a must visit New York City gem.

Such a special dining spot - my friend and I came with bellies full but once the food arrived, suddenly I was hungry again and I had space in my belly because I couldn‚Äôt not eat everything in front of me. Eli and the staff were all incredible - the most warming and welcoming energy.

You immediately knew you‚Äôd be in good hands. Need to come back for a full service dinner ASAP!!!

The most beautiful fused Korean and Canjun flavors I‚Äôve had. Everything felt fresh and inventive, with perfectly balanced seasoning. The sour watermelon was a bright and appetite-opening surprise. I don‚Äôt see people order chicken liver, but it turned out to be one of my favorites, along with the okra kimchi. The kimchi jambalaya was rich and flavorful, packed with kimchi and meat, while the seafood jjajangmyeon tasted more like pasta with picked radish, it wasn‚Äôt my top pick. The space is more but atmospheric, perfect for a small gathering or date.

My type of soul food soul food soul food!!! We scraped all the plates clean. I want to come here every month. I wish the chef was my mom.

Best Korean fusion with Louisiana New Orleans vibe.

Delicious food, great vibes, and amazing service. It‚Äôs really hard to find a restaurant this special in NYC - a place that makes you feel like you‚Äôre eating the best home cooked meal with close friends. Thank you Chef Jae, Neil, and Eli for making our night!

We drove an hour and a half to try this restaurant, and while the experience was okay, the food wasn't exactly what we're used to. We had the dinner for Two which included a snack, two entrees, and dessert. We ordered the Soy-Marinated Eggs & Cracklin' as our snack, Beaucoup Fried Chicken with collard greens and okra, and Galbi Brisket & Grits as our entrees. We also added an extra snack, Cornbread Hushpuppies, and had the pecan pie for dessert.

The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't necessarily to my taste. However, I did enjoy the hush puppies and pecan pie. One issue we had was with the chicken being undercooked. Our waitress mentioned that she wished we had spoken up so she could have fixed it, but when looked at the table next to us, their chicken seemed to be cooked similarly, so it might be the way they prepare it.

As for the service, our waitress wasn't unfriendly, but her personality just didn't click with me. She wasn't rude or anything, but I couldn't quite connect with her.

Given the experience, I'm not sure if I'll be back, but I do appreciate trying something new.

First Impressions
I first discovered KJUN on 39th Street in Murray Hill last year, and Chef Jae Jung‚Äôs cuisine immediately stood out for its bold flavors and inventive twists. Returning this time with a friend, we were eager to see if the experience would live up to the high bar set on our inaugural visit. From start to finish, KJUN delivered a dining adventure that exceeded expectations once again.

The Appetizer
We began with the Cod Beignet‚ÄîMama Kim‚Äôs flaked cod enveloped in a light, crispy batter and served alongside a bright wasabi aioli. The contrast of crunchy exterior and tender fish inside was spot-on, and the gentle heat of the wasabi aioli cut through the richness, setting the tone for what was to come.

Main Courses
Galbi Brisket & Grits Galbi-marinated brisket arrived meltingly tender atop a bed of cheesy grits, with bursts of acidity from cherry tomato kimchi. Each bite balanced savory, creamy, and tangy notes in perfect harmony.

Seafood Jjajangmyun Sweet potato starch noodles were bathed in a deeply umami fermented black bean sauce and studded with saut√©ed shrimp, calamari, and poached lobster. The unexpected addition of a cornmeal-crusted oyster added crunch and another layer of oceanic flavor.

Final Thoughts
Just like our first visit, KJUN once again impressed with dishes that feel like a flavor festival in every bite. Chef Jae Jung‚Äôs knack for fusing textures and tastes shines through on every plate. We left already planning our next reservation‚ÄîKJUN is a must-try for anyone seeking inventive Korean-inspired fare on Manhattan‚Äôs East Side.

Wow... nothing excites me more when cuisines become wedded. The owner and staff were so polite and attentive. We ordered an abundance of food knowing we wouldn't eat it all but didn't care. Below are my rankings of my favorites...

1. Fried chicken (you get two sides we had the green tomato kimchi and the kimchi okra) Chicken was incredibly crispy and the hot honey sauce they give you is to die for.

2. Hush puppies - taste like ones from the south (I'm from TN). These came w this amazing honey butter dip (mix it up - so good!).

3. Catfish nuggets (you don't even need the sauce they give you, it's that good)

4. BBQ shrimp (this was my gf's favorite. She grew up w family near New Orleans)

5. Ribs (these weren't as much of fusion but nevertheless were delicious and very tender)

6. Pecan pie ü•ß - it was smaller, almost mini, made w sweet potatoes for the filling. It was different but very good!

I will definitely be back!! Thank y'all!!
